text: Christmas is not a time or a season but a state of mind. To cherish peace and good will, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: All growth depends upon activity. There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: I have never been hurt by anything I didn't say.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Patriotism is easy to understand in America - it means looking out for yourself by looking out for your country.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: No man ever listened himself out of a job.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Heroism is not only in the man, but in the occasion.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: It takes a great man to be a good listener.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Perhaps one of the most important accomplishments of my administration has been minding my own business.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Those who trust to chance must abide by the results of chance.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: We cannot do everything at once, but we can do something at once.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Press on â€“ nothing can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Perseverance and determination alone are omnipotent.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: It is only when men begin to worship that they begin to grow.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: No nation ever had an army large enough to guarantee it against attack in a time of peace or ensure it of victory in time of war.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Patriotism is easy to understand in America; it means looking out for yourself by looking out for your country.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Christmas is not a time nor a season, but a state of mind. To cherish peace and goodwill, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Collecting more taxes than is absolutely necessary is legalized robbery.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not: nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Prosperity is only an instrument to be used, not a deity to be worshipped.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not: nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not: the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: If we judge ourselves only by our aspirations and everyone else only their conduct we shall soon reach a very false conclusion.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: All growth depends upon activity.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: When people are bewildered they tend to become credulous.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Economy is the method by which we prepare today to afford the improvements of tomorrow.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: We do not need more intellectual power, we need more spiritual power. We do not need more of the things that are seen, we need more of the things that are unseen.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Silence can never be misquoted.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: No enterprise can exist for itself alone. It ministers to some great need, it performs some great service, not for itself, but for others; or failing therein, it ceases to be profitable and ceases to exist.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: There is no escaping the fact that when the taxation of large incomes is excessive, they tend to disappear.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: We need more of the Office Desk and less of the Show Window in politics. Let men in office substitute the midnight oil for the limelight.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: There is no force so democratic as the force of an ideal.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: If we expect others to rely on our fairness and justice we must show that we rely on their fairness and justice.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Duty is not collective; it is personal.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: When more and more people are thrown out of work, unemployment results.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: The final solution for unemployment is work.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Four-fifths of all our troubles would disappear, if we would only sit down and keep still.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Human nature provides sufficient distrust of all that is alien, so that there is no need of any artificial supply.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward what he gave.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: I guess I am not naturally energetic. I like to sit around and talk.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Nothing in the world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful people with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost legendary. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan 'press on' has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Industry, thrift and self-control are not sought because they create wealth, but because they create character.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Don't expect to build up the weak by pulling down the strong.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: I always figured the American public wanted a solemn ass for President, so I went along with them.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: The only difference between a mob and a trained army is organization.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: The nation that forgets its defenders will itself be forgotten.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: If you see ten troubles coming down the road, you can be sure that nine will run into the ditch before they reach you.
author: Calvin Coolidge
